summary: This document is a financial alert from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a critical risk priority due to his history as a registered sex offender and various convictions related to sexual offenses and fraud. It details multiple incidents of legal issues and convictions, including soliciting prostitution and sexual offenses against minors. This document contains alerts from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting his status as a registered sex offender and various media articles related to his legal issues and connections with notable individuals, including Prince Andrew. The alerts indicate a critical risk priority associated with Epstein's activities and legal history. This document contains a series of alerts from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting various media articles related to lawsuits and allegations against him. It details the critical risk priority associated with Epstein and includes references to multiple lawsuits, settlements, and media coverage surrounding his legal issues. This document contains alerts from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting critical risk factors and regulatory actions taken against him. It details a disciplinary action by the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) where Epstein was suspended for exercising discretion in a customer's account without proper authorization.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the central figure in this document, facing multiple lawsuits and allegations of sexual misconduct. He is monitored by Deutsche Bank due to the critical risk associated with his legal troubles.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Prince Andrew is mentioned in connection with Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting his friendship with Epstein and the controversies surrounding it.

persons.name: Jeffrey Richard Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the document, flagged for critical risk by Deutsche Bank and noted for a regulatory action by FINRA.

connections.description: Prince Andrew is noted to have a friendship with Jeffrey Epstein, which has led to public scrutiny and controversy.

events.title: Served Jail Time
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein served 12 months for a state charge of prostitution solicitation and registered as a sex offender.

events.title: Conviction Listed
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein appears on the New York Sex Offenders site.

events.title: Conviction for Soliciting
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was serving time in jail for soliciting erotic massages.

events.title: Conviction for Postal Fraud
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was convicted of postal fraud for stealing his neighbor's mail.

events.title: Indicted for Solicitation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted on a charge of felony solicitation of prostitution.

events.title: Deutsche Bank Monitoring Alert
events.description: Deutsche Bank issued an alert regarding Jeffrey Epstein's status as a registered sex offender and his ongoing legal issues.

events.title: Lawsuit Filed by Girl's Family
events.description: The family of a girl filed a lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein seeking $50 million in damages for alleged sexual assault.

events.title: Judge Rules on Sealed Plea Deal
events.description: A judge ruled on whether to unseal Epstein's plea deal documents, which had been kept confidential.

events.title: Epstein Settles Lawsuits
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein settled two lawsuits filed by women claiming abuse at his Palm Beach mansion.

events.title: Victims Seek Epstein's Wealth
events.description: Victims of Jeffrey Epstein's alleged abuse sought to claim damages from his wealth, which was a point of contention in ongoing legal battles.

events.title: FINRA Disciplinary Action
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein submitted a Letter of Acceptance, Waiver and Consent, resulting in a 10-day suspension from association with any FINRA member for exercising discretion in a customer's account without authorization.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a registered sex offender since 2008 after pleading guilty to soliciting prostitution.
He has been convicted multiple times for various offenses including soliciting minors for prostitution.
By 2011, 40 underage girls had come forward with allegations of sexual assault against Epstein.
Epstein has made 17 out-of-court settlements as of May 2013.
The document alerts to Epstein's critical risk status due to his extensive criminal history.
Jeffrey Epstein is listed on the New York Sex Offenders site.
The document includes multiple media articles discussing Epstein's legal troubles and connections to Prince Andrew.
The alerts from Deutsche Bank indicate a critical risk priority associated with Epstein.
Prince Andrew's friendship with Epstein has led to significant public and media scrutiny.
The document emphasizes that the information is for alert purposes only and should not be used for determining individual eligibility.
Jeffrey Epstein is under critical monitoring by Deutsche Bank due to ongoing legal issues.
Multiple lawsuits have been filed against Epstein, including one seeking $50 million for alleged sexual assault.
A judge ruled on the unsealing of Epstein's plea deal documents, which had been kept confidential.
Epstein settled two lawsuits filed by women claiming abuse at his Palm Beach mansion.
Victims are seeking damages from Epstein's wealth, which remains a contentious issue in legal proceedings.
Jeffrey Epstein was flagged for critical risk by Deutsche Bank on June 15, 2017.
Epstein's date of birth is January 20, 1953.
He was suspended by FINRA for 10 business days due to unauthorized discretionary trading in a customer's account.
The document contains alerts related to Epstein's financial activities and regulatory compliance.
There are multiple mentions of Epstein's critical risk status in the context of financial monitoring.
